dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S797 IS: Family Building FEHB Fairness Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Duckworth (for herself, Mr. Welch, Ms. Warren, Mr. Padilla, Mr. Merkley, Mr. Booker, Mr. Coons, and Mr. Kaine) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to protect and expand access to fertility treatment under the health insurance program carried out under chapter 89 of that title, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Family Building FEHB Fairness Act.

subsection.text: Section 8904 of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: by redesignating subparagraph (F) as subparagraph (G); and
by inserting after subparagraph (E) the following:

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: In this section, the term fertility treatment includes the following:

paragraph.text: Preservation of human oocytes, sperm, or embryos for later reproductive use.
Artificial insemination, including intravaginal insemination, intracervical insemination, and intrauterine insemination.

Assisted reproductive technology, including in vitro fertilization and other treatments or procedures in which reproductive genetic material, such as oocytes, sperm, fertilized eggs, and embryos, are handled, when clinically appropriate.
Medications prescribed or obtained over-the-counter, as indicated for fertility.

Such other information, referrals, treatments, procedures, medications, laboratory services, technologies, and services relating to fertility as the Director of the Office of Personnel Management, in coordination with the Secretary of Health and Human Services, determines appropriate.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date that is 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act.
